subject: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Dear,
I'm Carey Portman from Altamonte Springs, Florida. 
I have worked in the gold mining sector for more than 30 years. Over these years I have had local mining contracts across 5 countries, namely: Australia, Brazil, South Africa, Kazakhstan and Ghana. 
Am currently working with a gold company in Ghana and my contract will expire by next year.  I privately bought about 240 KG of gold from some local miners here at a cheaper price. I don't want my company to know I own such gold because contractors are prohibited from buying gold from local miners.
 
So I want to present you as my partner who bought and owns the gold. All legal documentation will be in your name, then the company would ship the gold to your provided address. After you receive it then I can come over to pick it up. I'm willing to give you 30% of the total 240KG of gold.  All I want from you is honesty and transparency. 
 
If you're okay with the proposal, then I will get an attorney here to draft an agreement between us. As soon as we sign the agreement, I will give you the contact details of the company so you can contact them and instruct them to make the delivery to your address. All this can be done within 8-10 working days.
 
NOTE: This is 100% legal business. I bought the gold with my money.  Am only doing it because as a contractor with the company I'm not permitted to buy gold from the local miners.
The 240KG of gold is worth around 12.5 Million USD if we sell 1KG for 50,000USD. This is unrefined 23 Karat gold with 99% purity. 
 
If you need any further clarification, kindly let me know. 
I await your response and readiness to enable us to start the agreement process immediately. 
 
Thank You
Carey Portman.

subject: Re:   Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Carey Portman,

It's a pleasure to meet you. Your work in the gold mining sector sounds fascinating! I must admit, I don't know much about it, but your experience across different countries is impressive.

Your proposal is quite intriguing. However, I have a few questions before we proceed further. Could you please explain why the company prohibits buying gold from local miners? Also, how does the process of transferring legal ownership work?

I'm also curious about the value of unrefined Karat gold. Is its worth always stable or does it fluctuate like other commodities? 

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Travis

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Travis,

 Am glad you got back to me and I appreciate your interest in this business
proposal.

Here are clarifications to your questions:

A. Company prohibits it's staffs buying from the local miners because the
government restricts that. The government explained that local miners are
not been taxed or regulated, that's why they sell the gold so cheap. So no
company wants to have issues with the government concerning that. The local
miners also believe they own the land,  then manually mine and
harvest their gold, hence the government should not regulate or tax them.

B. The legal documentation will be done by a lawyer here. The certificate
of Origin, Deposit / ownership certificate and other relevant paperwork
will be done in your name before the shipping company proceeds with the
shipment to your address.

C. The value of unrefined gold is not thesame as the market price for
refined gold. But one good thing is that it does not depreciate in value.
Gold never depreciates though it fluctuates as usual.

I await your response to enable us proceed.

Best regards.
Carey Portman

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Carey,

Thank you for your detailed response. It's fascinating to learn about the intricacies of the gold industry and the local miners' perspective. I'm curious, how does the government regulate these local miners? And what are their views on this?

Regarding the legal aspect, it's reassuring to know that a lawyer will handle everything. Could you please elaborate more on what kind of paperwork is involved? 

Also, could you explain a bit more about the difference in value between unrefined and refined gold? How does this fluctuation affect our potential business?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Travis

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Tarvis,

The government labelled them as 'galamsey' you can check it out on google.
They don't want local miners to mine any gold. If you discover any gold in
your land, you have to hand it over to the government for mining while you
get compensated . The government believes it's illegal because gold is a
national treasure.

There will be a paperwork agreement between us regarding the shipping and
benefits.

You can check on google, the current price of refined gold is around 64,000
USD plus per KG while the local miners could sell the unrefined gold 50,000
USD per KGand  sometimes you could even buy it at 40,000USD plus per KG.

I appreciate your interest. We will start with the legal documentation
first.  I will submit your details to my lawyer to start with the
preliminary documentation and also drafting of the legal agreement.
Kindly send the following information to enable the lawyer proceed.
1. Your full name
2. Your address where the gold will be shipped to
3. A scan copy of your ID. or Passport
4. Your direct phone number for easy communication.

As soon as the above informations are received, the lawyer will proceed
with the necessary documentation immediately.

I await the information.
Best regards.
Carey Portman

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Carey Portman,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's fascinating to learn about the 'galamsey' situation and the government's stance on local gold mining. I must admit, I had no idea that gold was considered a national treasure in this way.

I'm intrigued by the potential benefits of this venture, especially considering the current price of refined gold. However, I do have a few questions before we proceed further.

Firstly, could you please elaborate more on the paperwork agreement? What kind of terms and conditions are usually included in such agreements?

Secondly, regarding the legal process, could you provide more information about what it entails? What role does your lawyer play in this process?

Lastly, while I understand that my personal details would be necessary for proceeding with this venture, I am a bit hesitant to share them at this stage. Could we perhaps discuss more about the business plan and its potential risks and rewards first?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Travis

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Travis,

Hope you're doing great today?
1. The conditions in the agreement are more about our responsibilities in
the proposal and your benefit.
 2. The lawyer is responsible for securing a legal endorsed agreement
between us. He will also work with the shipping company when needed. It's
important to involve him because I am not physically available to deal with
the gold shipping company and you're also not physically present here.
3. There is absolutely no risk involved. I personally bought the entire
gold over a period of 3-4 years with my hard earned money. So it's 100%
risk free. I have already proposed a reward in my first message to you
which is 30% of the total 240 KG of gold. This means you will own 72 KG
when we complete the business.
Best regards
Carey Portman

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Carey Portman,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I'm doing well, thank you for asking. It's good to know that a lawyer will be involved in this process to ensure everything is legally sound.

I'm curious about the shipping process though. How exactly does it work? And how long does it usually take for the gold to be shipped?

Also, could you please elaborate more on the reward system? I understand that I will own a certain KG of gold, but how is this calculated and distributed?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Travis

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Travis,

 Your message was received.  The shipment will be handled by a gold
shipping company. They will deliver directly to your provided address
hitch-free. It depends on your location as I don't really know your address
but the companies usually complete shipment within 2-3 working days.

Your reward is 30% of the total Kilos of gold which is 72KG. It depends on
how much you wish to sell but the minimum amount is 50,000USD. you can
decide to sell a bit higher than that or lower. But if you sell at
50,000USD per KG, that means you would get 3,600,000.00 USD for the 72 KG.
Best regards
Carey Portman

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Travis,

Thank you for your message. It's great to hear that the shipment will be handled by a gold shipping company. That sounds very reliable and efficient! 

I'm curious, how does the delivery process work? Do they have a tracking system in place so I can follow the progress of my shipment?

Also, regarding the reward, could you please clarify a bit more? I'm not quite sure I understand how it's calculated. Is it based on the total kilos of gold or something else?

And lastly, when you mention selling at per KG, is there a specific market rate or does it depend on individual negotiation?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Travis

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Travis,

Yes, they have a tracking system where you track and monitor the
shipment progress until it gets to your address.

2. Yes, the calculation is based on the kilos of gold you have because it's
already on a gold bar, so you can sell per gold bar.

3. There is a specific market price for refined gold. But the unrefined
gold, there's no specific market price, it is individual negotiation.
Best regards
Carey Portman

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Travis,

Thank you for your inquiry. I'm glad to inform you that there is indeed a tracking system in place. This allows you to monitor the progress of your shipment until it reaches your address. Isn't that convenient?

As for the gold, it's quite interesting how it works. The price is based on the weight of the gold bars you have. So, if you have more gold bars, then naturally, you'd be able to sell more.

Now when it comes to refined gold, there's a specific market price for it. However, unrefined gold doesn't have a set market price and depends on individual negotiations.

I hope this information helps! Do let me know if there are any other aspects you're curious about.

Best wishes,
Travis

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
That's 100% correct.

We await your information to enable us proceed accordingly.
Regards
Mr. Carey

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Mr. Carey,

Thank you for your message. I'm eager to learn more about what we're proceeding with. Could you please provide me with some more details?

Best wishes,
Travis

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Travis,

 Please what further details do you need ?  I will be glad to clarify any
aspect you're still curious about.
Regards
Mr. Carey

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Mr. Carey,

Thank you for your prompt response. I'm interested in knowing more about the project you mentioned earlier. Could you please provide some additional details? What is the main goal of this project and how do you plan to achieve it? 

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Travis

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Travis,

I only want you to be my foreign partner to receive the gold in your
country. Then, when I am done with my contract here in the next 2-3 months,
I will come over to pick it up from you. So I'm offering you 30% for
standing as a partner for me. That's what I want from you. If you're
interested then we can proceed.

Thank you
Mr. Carey

subject: Re: Hello Dear,
body:
Hello Mr. Carey,

Thank you for considering me as your foreign partner. It's quite an interesting proposal you have there! I'm curious, how did you come across my name for this partnership? Also, could you please provide more details about the gold? Where is it coming from and how will it be transported to my country?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Travis
